sentences: Ta on mingis m√µttes hea mees.
context: The word 'mingid' is the plural form of the indefinite pronoun 'mingi' in Estonian. It's used to refer to unspecified or unidentified things or people, similar to how 'some', 'certain', or 'any' are used in English. In sentences, it typically appears before a noun to indicate an unknown or unspecified quantity or quality.
